questiontext.text:
Find the values of x for which the following matrix has no inverse :

$$\small \begin{pmatrix}-1 &-3 &-1 \\1 &-4 &x \\x &1 &-2\end{pmatrix}\:$$

[Express the answers in increasing order such that x1 < x2]

x1 ={1:NUMERICAL:=-3:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}x2 ={1:NUMERICAL:=1:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
When a matrix has no inverse, the determinant of the matrix is equal to 0. So,

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}-1 &-3 &-1 \\1 &-4 &x \\x &1 &-2\end{vmatrix}\: = 0 $$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$\small-1((8) - (1x)) - (-3)((-2) - x^{2}) + (-1)((1) - (-4x)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\small-x^{2}-6x+9 = 0 $$

Solving for x, we get:

$$ \small x_{1} =-3$$
$$\small x_{2} =1$$
